intro: Thesium hirtulum, commonly known as the hairy thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, dry fruits. Thesium hirtulum is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
